Project information is usually distributed between various types of documents. It is essential to keep the traceability between the statements in different documents.
  • Create a new document "Portal Specification" which will contain functional requirements
  • Change the document prefix to PSPEC
  • Configure the work item settings and display the Outline Number instead of id as field at start
  • Create following functional requirements in Portal Specification document
    Hint: Set requirement type to Functional Requirement 

    • I as a user want to perform simple searches
    • I as a user want to perform advanced searches
  • Set status of above requirements to Reviewed
  • Open CRS_E-Library document in new browser tab
  • Select requirement "The user should be able to search for books"
  • Start linking using "create link" symbol
  • Select role "refines" using linking dialog.



  • Switch back to document "Portal Specification"
  • Hold key "Ctrl" and link requirement "I as a user want to perform simple searches"  and "I as a user want to perform advanced searches" using the "create link" symbol
  • Confirm your links using the linking dialog


  • Switch back to document CRS_E-Library and save it to save your links
  • Create following functional requirements in document Portal Specification
    •  Password must be validated when the user wants to change it
      • Password must contain at least one number
      • Password must contain at least 8 characters
  • Add parent/child relationship between requirements which reflects the hierarchical structure shown above by using the [TAB] key
  • Set status for all three requirements to reviewed
  • Link parent requirement to "User should be able to login to E-Library of the CRS_E-Library document using steps described above.
  • Navigate via links between the different documents. Verify that traceability is available in both directions
